meanings.definition: A person employed to handle correspondence, keep records, and make appointments.
meanings.sent1: The secretary answered phone calls and replied to emails in the office.
meanings.sent2: The school secretary organized the files and scheduled parent-teacher meetings.
meanings.sent3: The secretary accidentally sent a funny cat video to the entire mailing list.
meanings.sent4: She was the secretary of the club, always keeping everyone in line and on track.
meanings.sent5: The secretary's desk was overflowing with papers, like a mountain of tasks waiting to be conquered.

meanings.definition: An official in charge of a department of government.
meanings.sent1: The secretary of defense made important decisions regarding national security.
meanings.sent2: The secretary of state represented the country in diplomatic meetings.
meanings.sent3: The secretary jokingly declared a 'no broccoli' policy in the government cafeteria.
meanings.sent4: She was the secretary of education, shaping the future of young minds.
meanings.sent5: The secretary's office was like a fortress, guarding the secrets of the nation.
